definition: to be an eyesore/(fig.) to spoil the fun/to be a wet blanket
to terminate/to cut short/to bring to a stop/to squeeze/to tighten/to damage/variant of 殺|杀[sha1]
see 大殺風景|大杀风景[da4 sha1 feng1 jing3]

sentences.english: The teenagers don't invite Bob to their parties because he is a wet blanket.
sentences.chinese: 少年們不邀請鮑伯參加舞會，因爲他常煞風景。

sentences.english: Only on hearing this did he change his mind. This unpleasant event made me quite unhappy.
sentences.chinese: 這次大煞風景的導遊，令我頗爲不快。

sentences.english: At such a happy moment , please stop saying unpleasant things.
sentences.chinese: 在這愉快的時刻，你不要說煞風景的話。

sentences.english: A tourist spot covered with trash is a real eyesore.
sentences.chinese: 旅遊景點遍地垃圾，總會讓人覺得大煞風景。

sentences.english: One answer to these questions is that nobody likes a party pooper .
sentences.chinese: 以上問題的一個解釋是沒人喜歡煞風景的人。

sentences.english: What a killjoy shitbag he is.
sentences.chinese: 他真是個煞風景的屎蛋。

sentences.english: The forecast of rain cast a wet blanket over our picnic plan.
sentences.chinese: 天氣預報有雨，使我們的野餐計劃大煞風景。

sentences.english: In another situation, the wife thing would have been a deal-breaker.
sentences.chinese: 在其他情況下，有妻子可能就很煞風景。

definition: please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
the rice is cooked/what's done is done/it's too late to change anything now (idiom)
pinyin: sheng1 mi3 zhu3 cheng2 shu2 fan4

definition: without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
